heisig_chinese_memo: The clown has metal push buttons all over him which trigger pranks on the unsuspecting victims.
Ru_trainchinese: niǔ: (сущ) пуговица; кнопка, переключатель (на устройстве)
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The clown has metal push buttons all over him which trigger pranks on the unsuspecting victims.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " gold " to " ugly " sound. The original meaning is Yin Nose, the carving on the top of the seal. "Said Wen": "The button is printed on the nose. From gold, the ugly sound. 㺲, the ancient style button is made from jade." Duan Yucai's note: "The ancient style is made of jade, and the ancient word printed on the button is made from jade. At that time, only jade was the only choice." For example, the Ji Yun Collection of the Qing Dynasty "Old Rituals of the Han Officials": "The Golden Seal of the Princes and Kings, the Camel Button, and the Wen Said Seal." Etiquette 6": "Prince, Golden Seal Tortoise Button, Zhu Shou, Three Hundred and Twenty." "Turtle Button" is a tortoise-shaped carving on the top of the seal.

" Button " connects with " Button ". Zhang Shunhui's "Shuowen Jie Zi Yue Annotation": "The words of the button are printed with a nose, so it is a button. Therefore, the scriptures use the button as the button. "Zhou Li" Bian Shi "Yan Niu" note: "New , Little nose." Yes." Such as "Southern Qi Shu. "Auspicious Chronicles": "Taoist Fu Dezhan excavated it, three feet deep, and received a jade seal. The text says "Long Cheng Wanfu"." " Button " is used as a measure word. Another example is Huang Tingjian of the Northern Song Dynasty "Returning Home to Cheng Bo's Family": "The North Window Booklet hasn't been opened for a long time, and the yellow dust on the basket produces buttons." " Buttons " refer to the holes of ropes or chains.

" Button " also means clothes buttons. "Zhengzitong. "The Ministry of Gold": "Buttons and clothes hooks are also called buttons." Such as Feng Menglong's "Awakening the World Hengyan." Wu Ya Nei Neighboring Boat to Go for an Appointment": "Wu Ya Nei held Miss He, loosened the button, undressed, and both pillows." Another verb means to buckle. For example, in the Qing Dynasty, Li Baojia's "The Appearance of Officialdom" Chapter 55: "(Xiao Changgui) draped a long coat on his body, before he had time for the buttons, he took a bundle of his waist and dragged a pair of shoes."
humanum_short_description_en: From " gold " to " ugly " sound. The original meaning is Yin Nose, the carving on the top of the seal.
humanum_full_description:
從「金」，「丑」聲。本義是印鼻，即印章上端的雕飾。《說文》：「鈕，印鼻也。从金，丑聲。㺲，古文鈕从玉。」段玉裁注：「壐之籒文从玉，古文印鈕字从玉。葢初作印時，惟以玉爲之也。」如清代紀昀輯《漢官舊儀》：「諸侯王黃金璽，橐駝鈕，文曰璽。」《隋書．禮儀志六》：「皇太子，金璽龜鈕，朱綬，三百二十首。」「龜鈕」即印章上端有龜形雕飾。

　　「鈕」通「紐」。張舜徽《說文解字約注》：「鈕之言紐也，印之有鼻，所以系紐也。故經傳即以紐為鈕。《周禮》弁師『延紐』注云：『紐，小鼻。』是已。」如《南齊書．祥瑞志》：「道士傅德占使掘之，深三尺，獲玉印一鈕，文曰『長承萬福』。」「鈕」作量詞。又如北宋黃庭堅〈還家呈伯氏〉：「北窗書冊久不開，筐篋黃塵生鎖鈕。」「鈕」指繩索或鐵鏈的穿繫的環孔。

　　「鈕」也表示衣扣。《正字通．金部》：「鈕，衣鉤亦曰鈕。」如明代馮夢龍《醒世恒言．吳衙內鄰舟赴約》：「吳衙內捧過賀小姐，鬆開鈕釦，解卸衣裳，雙雙就枕。」又作動詞，表示扣上。如清代李寶嘉《官場現形記》第55回：「（蕭長貴）把長衣披在身上，來不及鈕扣子，拿紮腰攔腰一捆，拖了一雙鞋。」
humanum_short_description: 從「金」，「丑」聲。本義是印鼻，即印章上端的雕飾。

從「 金 」，「 丑 」聲。本義是印鼻，即印章上端的雕飾。《說文》：「鈕，印鼻也。从金，丑聲。㺲，古文鈕从玉。」段玉裁注：「壐之籒文从玉，古文印鈕字从玉。葢初作印時，惟以玉爲之也。」如清代紀昀輯《漢官舊儀》：「諸侯王黃金璽，橐駝鈕，文曰璽。」《隋書．禮儀志六》：「皇太子，金璽龜鈕，朱綬，三百二十首。」「龜鈕」即印章上端有龜形雕飾。 「 鈕 」通「 紐 」。張舜徽《說文解字約注》：「鈕之言紐也，印之有鼻，所以系紐也。故經傳即以紐為鈕。《周禮》弁師『延紐』注云：『紐，小鼻。』是已。」如《南齊書．祥瑞志》：「道士傅德占使掘之，深三尺，獲玉印一鈕，文曰『長承萬福』。」「 鈕 」作量詞。又如北宋黃庭堅〈還家呈伯氏〉：「北窗書冊久不開，筐篋黃塵生鎖鈕。」「 鈕 」指繩索或鐵鏈的穿繫的環孔。 「 鈕 」也表示衣扣。《正字通．金部》：「鈕，衣鉤亦曰鈕。」如明代馮夢龍《醒世恒言．吳衙內鄰舟赴約》：「吳衙內捧過賀小姐，鬆開鈕釦，解卸衣裳，雙雙就枕。」又作動詞，表示扣上。如清代李寶嘉《官場現形記》第55回：「（蕭長貴）把長衣披在身上，來不及鈕扣子，拿紮腰攔腰一捆，拖了一雙鞋。」

鈕字的基本解释

鈕
niǔ
见“钮”。

鈕字的汉语字典释义

[①]［niǔ］
［《廣韻》女久切，上有，娘。］
“钮1”的繁体字。
(1)印鼻，印章上端的雕饰。古代用以分别官印的等级。有各种不同的形式，如瓦钮、龟钮、虎钮、狮钮等。
(2)器物上面可以提携或系绳带的部分。
(3)衣纽，扣子。
(4)使合在一起；扣上。
(5)器物上用于操作、转动的部分。
(6)量词。枚；方。计量印数的量词。
(7)姓。清有钮琇，著有《觚賸》等。
[②]［chǒu］
［《集韻》敕九切，上有，徹。］
“钮2”的繁体字。
刑具。枷锁镣铐之类。

鈕字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鈕； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页1298第23
〔古文〕㺲【唐韻】【集韻】【正韻】?女九切，音狃。【說文】印鼻也。【正韻】又鏡弩鼻。【正字通】凡物鉤固者，皆曰鈕。　又【楚辭·九思】遺失兮鈕樞。【註】玉斗鈕樞，皆所寶者。　又姓。【何氏姓苑】東晉有鈕?，吳興人。　又【集韻】敕九切，音丑。與杻同。械也。

鈕字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
鈕字的起名意思

暂无。

button
Basic explanation of words
button
niǔ
See "button".
button
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［niǔ］
["Guangyun" female long cut, there is on it, mother. ]
Traditional characters for "button 1".
(1) The printed nose, the carving on the top of the seal. In ancient times, it was used to distinguish the rank of official seals. There are a variety of different forms, such as tile button, turtle button, tiger button, lion button and so on.
(2) The part on the utensil that can be carried or tied.
(3) Clothes buttons and buttons.
(4) Bring together; buckle up.
(5) The part used for operation and rotation of the utensil.
(6) Quantifiers. Pieces; square. A quantifier for measuring print counts.
(7) Last name. There was Niu Xuan in the Qing Dynasty, and the author of "The Leftovers" and so on.
[②] [chǒu]
["Ji Yun" Chi Nine cuts, with on top, thorough. ]
Traditional characters for "Button 2".
Instruments of torture. Shackles and the like.
button
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Su Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　 Niu; Kangxi strokes: 12; Page number: Page 1298 Page 23
〔古文〕㺲【Tang Yun】【Ji Yun】【Zheng Yun】? Female nine cuts, sound awkward. [Said the text] The nose is also printed. [Zheng Yun] You look at the nose of the crossbow. [Zhengzitong] All things hooked solidly are called buttons.　[Chu Ci·Nine Thoughts] Lost the Xi button. [Note] Jade bucket button hinges are all treasures.　Another last name. [Ho's Surname Garden] There are buttons in the Eastern Jin Dynasty?, from Wuxing.　[Jiyun] Nine cuts, ugly sound. Same as Tiao. Machinery also.
